result.markdown:
--- title: "formatdown v0.1.2" description: | Adding functionality to formatting tools for numerical quantities in vectors or data frames when creating documents in rmarkdown or quarto markdown date: "July 9, 2023" date-format: "YYYY--MM--DD" categories: [R, engineering notation, scientific notation, units, rmarkdown, quarto] image: "thumbnail.png" cap-location: margin draft: true --- ::: callout-note ## Summary Add functionality to improve usability by addressing issues raised during testing. New arguments in the powers-of-ten function for math delimiters and fixed exponents. New functions to format decimal and integer values and to interact with the units package. ::: Having successfully submitted the formatdown package to CRAN in November, 2022, I wrote a [post](https://graphdr.github.io/data-stories/posts/2022-11-18-formatdown/) to introduce the package and immediately uncovered several issues that had not appeared while working on the package vignettes. Those issues have been addressed and the latest release includes: - New arguments `delim` and `set_power` in `format_power()`. - New function `format_decimal()` and vignette. - New function `format_units()` and vignette. - New data sets `atmos`, `metals`, `water`, and `air_meas`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(formatdown) library(data.table) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) ``` ::: ## Delimiters A described in the original [post](https://graphdr.github.io/data-stories/posts/2022-11-18-formatdown/#delimiter-issue), `format_power()` rendered from a quarto document (as in this blog) failed when using `knitr::kable()` and `kableExtra::kbl()` even though they rendered correctly in the package vignette output. Here, I'll recreate the failure, starting with the `air_meas` data set. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # View the raw data air_meas ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens 1: 2018-06-12 a low 294.1 101100 287 1.198 2: 2018-06-13 b high 294.1 101000 287 1.196 3: 2018-06-14 c med 294.6 101100 287 1.196 4: 2018-06-15 d low 293.4 101000 287 1.200 5: 2018-06-16 e high 293.9 101100 287 1.199 ``` ::: ::: Extract the pressure column as a data frame. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT <- air_meas[, .(pres)] DT ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` pres 1: 101100 2: 101000 3: 101100 4: 101000 5: 101100 ``` ::: ::: First, I'll use `format_power()` in an inline R chunk to show the expected result. The inline code given by `` `r format_power(DT$pres)` `` yields the following when rendered in the document: $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ , $101.0 \times 10^{3}$ , $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ , $101.0 \times 10^{3}$ , $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ Next, I'll format the column and retain the data frame, you can see the markup. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT$pres <- format_power(DT$pres, 4) DT ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` pres 1: $101.1 \\times 10^{3}$ 2: $101.0 \\times 10^{3}$ 3: $101.1 \\times 10^{3}$ 4: $101.0 \\times 10^{3}$ 5: $101.1 \\times 10^{3}$ ``` ::: ::: Creating a table using `knitr::kable()`, the math markup `$ ... $` is not rendered as math---in this Quarto Markdown blog post. (The same script in an R Markdown script (.Rmd) does render correctly.) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} kable(DT) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
pres
$101.1 \times 10^{3}$
$101.0 \times 10^{3}$
$101.1 \times 10^{3}$
$101.0 \times 10^{3}$
$101.1 \times 10^{3}$
````` ::: ::: Using the `delim` argument to replace `$ ... $` with `\\( ... \\)` yields the new markup, ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT <- air_meas[, .(pres)] DT$pres <- format_power(DT$pres, 4, delim = "\\(") DT ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` pres 1: \\(101.1 \\times 10^{3}\\) 2: \\(101.0 \\times 10^{3}\\) 3: \\(101.1 \\times 10^{3}\\) 4: \\(101.0 \\times 10^{3}\\) 5: \\(101.1 \\times 10^{3}\\) ``` ::: ::: which `kable()` correctly renders as math markup. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} kable(DT) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
pres
\(101.1 \times 10^{3}\)
\(101.0 \times 10^{3}\)
\(101.1 \times 10^{3}\)
\(101.0 \times 10^{3}\)
\(101.1 \times 10^{3}\)
````` ::: ::: ## stuff ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT <- copy(air_meas) DT$pres <- format_power(DT$pres, 4) DT ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens 1: 2018-06-12 a low 294.1 $101.1 \\times 10^{3}$ 287 1.198 2: 2018-06-13 b high 294.1 $101.0 \\times 10^{3}$ 287 1.196 3: 2018-06-14 c med 294.6 $101.1 \\times 10^{3}$ 287 1.196 4: 2018-06-15 d low 293.4 $101.0 \\times 10^{3}$ 287 1.200 5: 2018-06-16 e high 293.9 $101.1 \\times 10^{3}$ 287 1.199 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::kable(DT, align = "r") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 $101.0 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 $101.0 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.199
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} kableExtra::kbl(DT, align = "r") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 $101.0 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 $101.0 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ 287 1.199
````` ::: ::: $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ The new `delim` argument in `format_power()` enables an author to change delimiters from the default `$ ... $` delimiters to `\\( ... \\)`. The argument is a character vector (length 1 or 2) defining the delimiters for marking up inline math. Possible values include "`$`" or "`\\(`", both of which create appropriate left and right delimiters. Alternatively, left and right can be defined explicitly in a character vector of length two, e.g., `c("$", "$")` or `c("\\(", "\\)")`. Custom delimiters can be assigned to suit the markup environment. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT <- copy(air_meas) DT$pres <- format_power(DT$pres, 4, delim = c("\\(", "\\)")) DT ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens 1: 2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \\(101.1 \\times 10^{3}\\) 287 1.198 2: 2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \\(101.0 \\times 10^{3}\\) 287 1.196 3: 2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \\(101.1 \\times 10^{3}\\) 287 1.196 4: 2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \\(101.0 \\times 10^{3}\\) 287 1.200 5: 2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \\(101.1 \\times 10^{3}\\) 287 1.199 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::kable(DT, align = "r") # works ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \(101.0 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \(101.0 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.199
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} kableExtra::kbl(DT, align = "r") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \(101.0 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \(101.0 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) 287 1.199
````` ::: ::: $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Substitute math delimiters DT$pres <- gsub("10\\^\\{3\\}", "\\{10^3\\}", DT$pres) DT ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens 1: 2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \\(101.1 \\times {10^3}\\) 287 1.198 2: 2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \\(101.0 \\times {10^3}\\) 287 1.196 3: 2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \\(101.1 \\times {10^3}\\) 287 1.196 4: 2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \\(101.0 \\times {10^3}\\) 287 1.200 5: 2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \\(101.1 \\times {10^3}\\) 287 1.199 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::kable(DT, align = "r") # works ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \(101.1 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \(101.0 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \(101.1 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \(101.0 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \(101.1 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.199
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} kableExtra::kbl(DT, align = "r") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \(101.1 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \(101.0 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \(101.1 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \(101.0 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \(101.1 \times {10^3}\) 287 1.199
````` ::: ::: $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ $101.1 \times 10^{3}$ \(101.1 \times 10^{3}\) \[101.1 \times 10^{3}\] ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT$pres <- gsub(" ", "", DT$pres) DT ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens 1: 2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \\(101.1\\times{10^3}\\) 287 1.198 2: 2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \\(101.0\\times{10^3}\\) 287 1.196 3: 2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \\(101.1\\times{10^3}\\) 287 1.196 4: 2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \\(101.0\\times{10^3}\\) 287 1.200 5: 2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \\(101.1\\times{10^3}\\) 287 1.199 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::kable(DT, align = "r") # works ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \(101.1\times{10^3}\) 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \(101.0\times{10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \(101.1\times{10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \(101.0\times{10^3}\) 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \(101.1\times{10^3}\) 287 1.199
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} kableExtra::kbl(DT, align = "r") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
date trial humid temp pres sp_gas dens
2018-06-12 a low 294.1 \(101.1\times{10^3}\) 287 1.198
2018-06-13 b high 294.1 \(101.0\times{10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-14 c med 294.6 \(101.1\times{10^3}\) 287 1.196
2018-06-15 d low 293.4 \(101.0\times{10^3}\) 287 1.200
2018-06-16 e high 293.9 \(101.1\times{10^3}\) 287 1.199
````` ::: ::: ### Additional software credits {.appendix} - [`checkmate`](https://mllg.github.io/checkmate/) for internal function argument checks - [`wrapr`](https://winvector.github.io/wrapr/) for internal function authoring tools - [`units`](https://r-quantities.github.io/units/) for managing units of physical quantities
